[Defunct] Get a show or movie's stats

trakt.stats pulls show stats and returns it compactly. The data includes show ratings, scrobbles, checkins, plays, comments…

trakt.stats(target, type = "shows", extended = "min")

Arguments

target
The id of the show/movie requested. Either the slug (e.g. "game-of-thrones"), trakt id or IMDb id.
type
Either shows (default) or movies, depending the target type.
extended
Whether extended info should be provided. Defaults to "min", can either be "min" or "full".

Value

A data.frame containing show stats

Note

See http://docs.trakt.apiary.io/#reference/shows/stats

See also

Other movie data: trakt.movie.people, trakt.movie.ratings, trakt.movie.releases, trakt.movie.summary, trakt.movie.watching, trakt.movies.popular, trakt.movies.related, trakt.movies.trending

Other show data: trakt.get_all_episodes, trakt.get_full_showdata, trakt.seasons.season, trakt.seasons.summary, trakt.show.people, trakt.show.ratings, trakt.show.summary, trakt.show.watching, trakt.shows.popular, trakt.shows.related, trakt.shows.trending

Examples

## Not run: ------------------------------------
# get_trakt_credentials() # Set required API data/headers
# breakingbad.stats <- trakt.stats(type = "shows", "breaking-bad")
## ---------------------------------------------
